BULLETIN NO. 136 
STANDARD AIRPORT ACCESS AGREEMENT 
06/05/2021 
 
 
THIS BULLETIN IS ADDRESSED FOR INFORMATION TO ALL MEMBERS WHO OPERATE STAND-ALONE 
INTO-PLANE, HYDRANT OR STORAGE FACILITIES REQUIRING THEM TO INTERACT WITH THE OTHER 
OPERATORS ON THE SAME AIRPORT. 
THIS BULLETIN INFORMS MEMBERS OF A NEW TEMPLATE "STANDARD AIRPORT ACCESS 
AGREEMENT" FOR VOLUNTARY USE AS NEEDED TO GOVERN THOSE SERVICE LEVELS AND 
RESPONSIBILITIES. 
 
BACKGROUND: 
As airport operations have become more fragmented, many JIG Members have requested the Common 
Processes Committee to propose a template Standard Airport Access Agreement to help regulate the 
relationship and service level expectations - in both directions - between into-plane providers on the one 
hand and hydrant/storage operators on the other. The template agreement has been prepared with help 
and input from those operators. 
SUMMARY: 
This new document, CP 8.07, is added to the portfolio of template JV Agreements that JIG already 
publishes for the benefit of its members. The document covers some specific areas of activity, including: 
- 
Agreement for all parties to follow JIG Standards 
- 
Service Levels - availability of the facilities 
- 
Service levels - integrity of equipment 
- 
Withdrawal of fuel and reporting requirements between the parties 
- 
Reporting of malfunctions and breakages 
-

The Agreement is available for download from the Standards & Publications page of the JIG Website 
(www.jig.org) in the Policies and Governance section, or by clicking on this link. It is a template document 
to be adapted as necessary and provided for voluntary use by users at their sole discretion and risk. 
There is no obligation for JIG Members nor JIG Joint Ventures to adopt this agreement. 
 
As stated above, all JIG's template JV Agreements are available for download from the website.
